column4: Hi, i need some help with a USB hard drive - it mounts as read only...
it does? where are you typing this?
and you typed it exactly?  df -Th  it has to be df, followed by a space, then - a capital 'T' and a lowercase 'h'
hrm, fat32 wouldn't be using the fuse block device... it would be using vfat
looks more like ntfs to me
can you pastebin the output of the dmesg command please?
odd... could I please ask you to pastebin the output of this command as well:  sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb
well, that says it's using 7, which is the NTFS disk label, so it must be NTFS.  give this a shot:  sudo umount /media/Backup && sudo ntfsfix /dev/sdb1
looks good, now run it again :)
it should say that it mounted correctly and that there are no errors
I see. see if you can write to it now
